result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called @ 11:18 AM Defendant Noah L. Johnston in court, in custody.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Noah L. Johnston. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment. Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains wavier of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NGP entered as to all counts. STC Scheduled - NOH Given. Bond modification argument by Atty Rae. The Court respectfully declines bond modification at this time. Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 10:10 am.
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 10:10 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant must comply with all mental health treatment and prescriptions.

Case called @ 1:12 PM Defendant Noah L. Johnston appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae appeared by video for Noah L. Johnston. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. SPD eligibility reliant on custody status. Bond argument by DA Leusink. Bond argument by Atty Rae. Court orders: $5000 cash bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
